description: Ms. codex. Title from lower edge. Physical description: 25 lines per page; written in small naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper. Rubrication and catchwords. First leaf detached. Mild staining. Origin: 1239 H [1823 or 1824] in Mashhad, by Muḥammad ʻAlī ibn Mīrzā Ismāʻīl (leaf 264b). Incipit: الحمد لله الذي اختص بالازلية والقدم وابرز نور الممكنات والقد من ظلمة العدم
author: Janājī, Jaʻfar ibn Khaḍir, 1743 or 1744-1811 or 1812
abstract: Treatise on Shiʻite doctrine and fiqh.
alternative: كشف الغطاء عن خفيات مبهمات الشريعة الغراء
extent: 264 leaves : paper ; 299 x 199 (216 x 134) mm bound to 306 x 205 mm
title: Kashf al-ghiṭāʼ
creator: جناجي، جعفر بن خضر، 1743 or 1744-1811 or 1812
subject: Shīʻah—Doctrines
binding_note: Full black leather with pink paper doublures.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
